credentials: PHD 2022 University of Texas at Austin
name: Ruhui JIN

ratings.comment: Won't say she is great, but is decent enough. Sometimes does not know what she is talking about, but was very clear what would be on the test. Followed Prof.Roch's textbook. The textbook dives deep into fundamentals and complex concept, so it was hard going through it without her explaining them in lecture. Took me some extra time to go through.

This is the worst professor I have ever met, not even sure she knows how to teach or not. The examples on notes are quite simple based on the theory, but the difficulty of questions on exams are way above the homeworks and examples on notes, and lectures are boring, no records of lectures, and hard to follow. Avoid.

Professor Jin does an okay job at teaching Math 340. Don't rely on the lectures alone to learn the material though - the best way to get a good score seemed to be by learning from the practice exams, to be honest. Her fill-in notes are good for quick skims though.

Professor Jin fits right in with most of the math department by being terrible at her job. Lecture examples were too superficial to translate to the homework, in turn making exam preparation more difficult. Also, I believe her sections had lower exam averages than others. Overall, she made an inherently challenging course even worse.

She is a very nice professor but not a good teacher. We only use fill-in-the-blank note sheets and almost all of the notes are theorems without numbers or very basic level examples. This leaves us super confused when homework/tests come around and we see more complicated questions. The questions on the homework are often nothing like the notes.

She is a nice and kind professor. However, her pacing is so slow and she spends too much time on easy concepts that are not helpful in homework, making students feel sleepy. Watching Youtube videos to learn will be better than going to her lecture. Give a lot of materials to study for the exam, which is a good thing.

Its definitely one of her first times teaching, but overall her lectures arent that great. They aren't recorded, and she usually has as note packet, where she jumps back and forth making it hard to follow. She dives pretty deep into simpler concepts that won't help too much on the homework. Overall, unorganized and dense lectures, would avoid.
